terms.definition: Relating to the abdomen (belly), the part of the body containing the digestive organs
A condition where you don't have enough healthy red blood cells to carry adequate oxygen to your body's tissues
Chest pain caused by reduced blood flow to the heart
A problem with the rate or rhythm of your heartbeat
Inflammation of one or more joints causing pain and stiffness
A condition that affects your airways and can make breathing difficult
Not harmful in effect; in particular, (of a tumor) not cancerous
An examination of tissue removed from a living body to discover the presence or cause of disease
Inflammation of the bronchi (airways) in the lungs
A type of cancer that starts in cells that make up the skin or the tissue lining organs
Related to the heart
Persisting for a long time or constantly recurring
A disease in which the body's ability to produce or respond to insulin is impaired
The identification of an illness or condition by examining symptoms
Swelling caused by excess fluid trapped in body tissues
A break in a bone
An escape of blood from a ruptured blood vessel
High blood pressure
Having abnormally high blood pressure
Abnormally low blood pressure
A localized physical condition where part of the body becomes reddened, swollen, and painful
A region of tissue that has suffered damage through injury or disease
A severe and progressively worsening disease, typically cancerous
A feeling of sickness with an inclination to vomit
The death of body tissue due to disease or injury
A medical condition in which the bones become brittle and fragile
Inflammation of the lungs caused by infection
The likely course of a medical condition
A group of symptoms that consistently occur together
Relating to the contraction of the heart

source: Medical Dictionary and Clinical Terms Database
